cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles ESE of Port O’Connor, TX
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then inland across south-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning posted from Baffin Bay to High Island, TX (west of Port Arthur)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Baffin Bay to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and adjacent western Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 25–35 mph with occasional gusts to around 50 mph possible Tuesday as the eastern semicircle brushes the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground level possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Lake entrance, especially if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals to 12 inches possible, producing flash-flood threat in the Port Arthur/Beaumont area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes or waterspouts cannot be ruled out in outer rainbands; reduced visibility and temporary closure of channel operations due to heavy rain and gusty squalls.
